intro: Paraphlomis kuankuoshuiensis, commonly known as the Kuankuoshui paraphlomis, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves, typical of the Lamiaceae family. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. This species is often found in moist, shaded environments in mountainous regions.
